byline.contributor: Rami Nazzal contributed reporting from Ramallah, West Bank.

abstract: Hunger strike by Palestinian lawyer Mohammad Allan results in his release from Israeli prison after he loses consciousness and Israeli Supreme Court deems him no longer threat; is hospitalized and doctors say two-month fast may have caused brain damage; friends expect incident will only harden resolve of Allan, member of militant group Islamic Jihad who has history of defiance against both Palestinian and Israeli authorities;
lead_paragraph: Mohammad Allan, an activist recently released from an Israeli prison, had long antagonized Palestinian and Israeli leaders and law enforcement.

headline.main: Palestinian’s 2-Month Hunger Strike Rooted in Defiant Past
headline.print_headline: Hunger Strike Rooted in Defiant Past

snippet: Mohammad Allan, an activist recently released from an Israeli prison, had long antagonized Palestinian and Israeli leaders and law enforcement.
